item.title: Coaching Vacancies – Wear Valley Swimming Club
item.dc:creator: Sarah Small
item.description:
Wear Valley Amateur Swimming Club are currently looking for a number of coaches to join their team of experienced coaches to ensure the continued development of their swimming programme. Details of these roles can be found below: Head Coach: Wear Valley Swimming Club Head Coach Job Advert Sep 2019 Part Time Coach: Wear Valley Swimming Club Part […]

The post Coaching Vacancies – Wear Valley Swimming Club appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Wear Valley Amateur Swimming Club are currently looking for a number of coaches to join their team of experienced coaches to ensure the continued development of their swimming programme. Details of these roles can be found below:

  • Head Coach: Wear Valley Swimming Club Head Coach Job Advert Sep 2019
  • Part Time Coach: Wear Valley Swimming Club Part Time Coach Job Advert Sep 2019

How to apply

If you are interested in applying for either of the roles, please submit your C.V. and a short summary as to why you are interested in the role to Susan Cooper at sucooper5@gmail.com.

The closing date for applications is Friday 4th October 2019, interviews to be held on Wednesday 16th October 2019, potential start date Monday 4th November 2019.

Post expires at 12:01am on Saturday October 5th, 2019

The post Coaching Vacancies – Wear Valley Swimming Club appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Important Information – Swim England Coaching and Teaching Register
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ramm
item.description:
Earlier this year, Swim England launched the Coaching and Teaching Register. This covers all coaches and teachers operating within affiliated clubs, regardless of qualification or discipline and currently more than 8,000 coaches and teachers from clubs across the country have signed up. There are still a number of clubs in the region who have not […]

The post Important Information – Swim England Coaching and Teaching Register appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Earlier this year, Swim England launched the Coaching and Teaching Register. This covers all coaches and teachers operating within affiliated clubs, regardless of qualification or discipline and currently more than 8,000 coaches and teachers from clubs across the country have signed up.

There are still a number of clubs in the region who have not yet registered any coaches or teachers on the system or; whose submission to the coach register shows that there are teacher(s) and or coach(es) within their club that either have no DBS check registered or have one that is more than three years old and therefore may not be not compliant with Swim England’s Child Safeguarding Policies and Procedures, Wavepower.

If your club has coaches or teachers operating within it, it is a requirement that they are registered and that information is complete. The register gives clubs an online and live record of their delivery workforce and of their workforce’s DBS and child safeguarding training (if appropriate) status. Both of these are a requirement of Swim England’s Child Safeguarding Policies and Procedures, as set out in Wavepower and therefore must be up-to-date.

In either of the above cases it is important that your club submits complete and accurate information to the coach register and/or address any gaps in DBS checks for your clubs coaches and staff. This must be completed by the 31st October 2019 at the latest.

Please also note that all individuals who are required to have a DBS check must complete approved child safeguarding training within a reasonable timescale of taking up the position.  Swim England will be further analysing the data received from the Coaching and Teaching Register and will address any issues regarding child safeguarding training in the coming months.  In the meantime, if you notice that one of your coaches or teachers does not have child safeguarding training recorded on the Register, the individual will need to provide proof of training to renewals@swimming.org and it can then be added to their record

All relevant information on the Coaching and Teaching Register (including and “Common Questions and Answers” document) can be found on the following web page : https://www.swimming.org/swimengland/coaching-teaching-register/

If you have any questions about DBS checks, please see the following web page: https://www.swimming.org/swimengland/dbs-faqs/  or email dbs@swimming.org

 

Notes

It may be that a coach does has a DBS check with another organisation and has registered for the DBS Update Service but has not shared this with Swim England.  In this case, please ask the coach/teacher to request a DBS Update Service Consent Form from dbs@swimming.org  and ensure that it is returned by 30 September 2019.

If you have coaches and teachers who only work with those over 18 years of age not deemed as ‘adults at risk’ then they must be included on the Coaching Register but they do not require a DBS check or child safeguarding training (definitions of adults at risk can be found at the following location https://swimming.org/library/documents/2747/download ).  Swim England requires you to send in written confirmation of this to renewals@swimming.org.  If you do not have any coaches or teachers at your club or there is any other reason preventing the club from using the Register, then again contact renewals@swimming.org

The post Important Information – Swim England Coaching and Teaching Register appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Opportunity for Swimming Coaches to Observe the National Development Programme
item.dc:creator: Sarah Small
item.description:
Swim England have recently released details of how swimming coaches are able to be observers on their National Development Programme camps (Phase 1). The three North East camps will be held in Huddersfield on the following days: Saturday 14th September 2019 Saturday 5th October 2019 Saturday 23rd November 2019. Details of what will be delivered […]

The post Opportunity for Swimming Coaches to Observe the National Development Programme appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Swim England have recently released details of how swimming coaches are able to be observers on their National Development Programme camps (Phase 1). The three North East camps will be held in Huddersfield on the following days:

  • Saturday 14th September 2019
  • Saturday 5th October 2019
  • Saturday 23rd November 2019.

Details of what will be delivered on the camps can be found here.

If you are interested in attending as an observer, please can you complete the following form: National Development Programme Form.

 

Post expires at 1:00am on Tuesday September 24th, 2019

The post Opportunity for Swimming Coaches to Observe the National Development Programme appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Have Your Say about Masters Swimming
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ramm
item.description:
Swim England are currently carrying out an insight (research) focus group on the needs of Masters Swimmers. The North East group will be held in the evening of 12th Sept in Harrogate between 6.30pm and 8.30pm. This is an opportunity for swimmers to shape the future of Masters swimming and swimmers from all backgrounds are […]

The post Have Your Say about Masters Swimming appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Swim England are currently carrying out an insight (research) focus group on the needs of Masters Swimmers. The North East group will be held in the evening of 12th Sept in Harrogate between 6.30pm and 8.30pm. This is an opportunity for swimmers to shape the future of Masters swimming and swimmers from all backgrounds are encouraged to come and talk about this, therefore, Swim England are keen to hear from swimmers who would like to attend.

 

If you are interested in attending then please contact National Masters Development Officer, Sharon Lock, on sharon.lock@swimming.org

Post expires at 9:42am on Saturday September 14th, 2019

The post Have Your Say about Masters Swimming appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Athena Aspire Club & Coach Conference 2019
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
A Club and Coach Conference has been scheduled by Athena Aspire for Tuesday 8th October at Bridlington Sports & Community Club 5:30-9pm. The purpose of the conference is to give coaches and volunteers the opportunity to learn from experts in a variety of different sporting fields. We aim to enable coaches to develop and progress […]

The post Athena Aspire Club & Coach Conference 2019 appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
A Club and Coach Conference has been scheduled by Athena Aspire for Tuesday 8th October at Bridlington Sports & Community Club 5:30-9pm.

The purpose of the conference is to give coaches and volunteers the opportunity to learn from experts in a variety of different sporting fields. We aim to enable coaches to develop and progress their own skills and in turn, be able to nurture athletes who have the potential to progress.

Who is the conference for? The conference is open to anyone involved in sport, health or physical activity across the Yorkshire Coast.

What does the conference cover? The Conference is a fantastic opportunity to attend less commonly accessible workshop themes such as Mental Health in Sports, Social Media & Funding support and business development. Including brilliant facilities at Bridlington Sports & Community Club together with sandwiches, refreshments and free parking book now to avoid disappointment!

How much does it cost? The conference is Free!

How do I book? To Book on the Conference Click Here! Book NOW to secure your place and avoid disappointment.

Places will be allocated on a first come, first served basis.  If you need any further information or have any queries please do not hesitate to contact Kara Savage on 01482 770122, 07432 712701 or ksavage@athenaaspire.com

 Overview: This conference will provide practical and theory development workshops around key hot topics that will be beneficial to a variety of clubs.

 Outcomes:

  • Opportunity to access informal development opportunities to support your own personal development and club development.
  • Greater awareness of new support you can access and programmes you can be part of.
  • Opportunity to feed your needs as a volunteer and coach to shape programme development.
  • Ability to network with like minded sports volunteers and professionals.

Agenda:

5.30pm Arrival, Registration & Refreshments

6.00pm Workshop 1-Mental Health Awareness in Sport and Physical Activity 

7.00pm Workshop 2- Social Media

8.00pm Workshop 3- Funding support and business development

9.00pm Depart

 

 

Post expires at 8:19am on Wednesday October 9th, 2019

The post Athena Aspire Club & Coach Conference 2019 appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: North East Region Coach Education Funding Scheme 2019 – 2020
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
Funding is now available from the Swim England North East Region for affiliated clubs to support them with their coaches completing various levels of coaching qualifications. For swimming, funding is available for Coaching (Level 2) and Senior Coaching (Level 3) qualifications and for Water Polo, Diving and Synchronised Swimming, funding is available for Assistant (Level […]

The post North East Region Coach Education Funding Scheme 2019 – 2020 appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Funding is now available from the Swim England North East Region for affiliated clubs to support them with their coaches completing various levels of coaching qualifications.

For swimming, funding is available for Coaching (Level 2) and Senior Coaching (Level 3) qualifications and for Water Polo, Diving and Synchronised Swimming, funding is available for Assistant (Level 1) and Coaching (Level 2) qualifications. Criteria for each of the disciplines can be found below:

  • Swimming: Swimming Coach Education Funding Scheme Criteria 2019 – 2020.
  • Diving: Diving Coach Education Funding Scheme Criteria 2019 – 2020.
  • Synchronised Swimming: Synchro Coach Education Funding Scheme Criteria 2019 – 2020.
  • Water Polo: Please contact the Regional Office for information on this.

The funding process is now open for applications and these should be completed using the following form: Coach  Education Funding Scheme 2019-20 Application Form.

The post North East Region Coach Education Funding Scheme 2019 – 2020 appeared first on Swim England North East.
